definition: to support one's family (idiom)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: We work to make a living, supporting ourselves and families. But now it is different.
sentences.chinese: 我們工作純粹只是爲了養家活口，然而現在不同了。

sentences.english: She feels it her duty to support her family.
sentences.chinese: 她感到養家活口是她的責任。

sentences.english: She thought she would not be able to bear the load of bringing up her family alone.
sentences.chinese: 她認爲她無法獨自一人擔負起養家活口的重任。

sentences.english: Women are now bearing the burden of being breadwinners.
sentences.chinese: 女性現在擔負着養家活口的責任。

sentences.english: You will know how important money is when you became a breadwinner yourself.
sentences.chinese: 等你要養家活口的時候，你就知道錢的重要了。

sentences.english: The father must provide food and clothes for his family.
sentences.chinese: 那位父親必須供給家裏衣食，養家活口。

sentences.english: Being the sole breadwinner, Mr. B feels very bad about being laid off.
sentences.chinese: 先生是唯一養家活口的人，他被解僱感到十分難過。

sentences.english: There has always been the breadwinner father, in charge of the day is over money.
sentences.chinese: 一貫有父親養家活口，掌管錢財的日子也就結束了。

sentences.english: Always have a father, was in charge of the money as breadwinners day was over.
sentences.chinese: 一向有父親養家活口，掌管財帛的日子也就完畢了。

definition: proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
part work, part study/work-study program
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
physical labor
(to act) on one's own initiative
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
in debt/in the red/in deficit
to be reluctant to give up a post
